channel.title: Cd rom
channel.description:
Hey guys,
My CD ROM was working like 1 week ago. Now it wont even recognize CD's and when I try to install Windows 7 it goes black.
Help if there is a way :|
Thanks, B2300 T4nk

@B2300_T4nk wrote:

item.title: Cd rom
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:6, topic:308268”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=404510.msg2993617#msg2993617 date=1255446653]
When did 2gb of Windows 7 manage to fit onto a CD?

Firstly try to re-install the driver for the drive. If that fails: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827151175 (You can replace these things blindfolded.)
[/quote] Cracked the code and downloaded the trial.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 13, 2009, 09:47:07 am[/size][hr]Also… If I restore my computer wont I loose all my files and shit>[/quote]

  1. Whichever Windows 7 distro you get, it is 2GB.
  2. YOU HAVE A DVD-ROM DRIVE
  3. You can just install Windows 7 within another windows os using disk mounting.
  4. I never said restore anything, I told you to [size=20pt]re-install[/size] the dvd drive driver.
  5. CD-ROM != DVD-ROM; re-install drive != restore.

Read full topic

item.title: Cd rom
item.dc:creator: @r0ckstar96 r0ckstar96
item.description:
@r0ckstar96 wrote:

Only your computer settings will be changed. For example: If you changed your computer settings 2 days ago, such as changed a background picture, and did a restore to 1 week ago, your settings would be undone, but you’ll still have all of your files. How do I know this? Personal experience.

Read full topic

If that fails: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827151175 (You can replace these things blindfolded.)[/quote] Cracked the code and downloaded the trial.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 13, 2009, 09:47:07 am[/size][hr]Also… If I restore my computer wont I loose all my files and shit>

item.title: Cd rom
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

When did 2gb of Windows 7 manage to fit onto a CD?

Firstly try to re-install the driver for the drive. If that fails: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16827151175 (You can replace these things blindfolded.)

Read full topic
